article: As the pace of life continues to increase, we are fast losing the art of relaxation. Once you are in the _ of rushing through life, being on the go from morning till night, it is hard to _ down. But relaxation is essential for a _ mind and body. Stress is natural part of everyday life and there is no way to _ it. In fact, it is not the bad thing it is often _ to be. A certain amount of stress is vital to provide _ and give purpose to life. It is only _ the stress gets out of control that it can lead to _ performance and ill health. The amount of stress arsons can withstand depends very much _ the individual. Some people are not afraid of stress, and _ characters are obviously prime material for managerial responsibilities. Others lose _ at the first signs of unusual difficulties. When _ to stress, in whatever form, we react both chemically and _ . In fact we make choice between flight and fight and in more primitive days the choices made the difference _ life and death. The crises we meet today are _ to be so extreme, but however little the stress, it _ the same response. It is when such a reaction lasts long, through continued _ to stress, that health becomes _ Such serious conditions as high blood pressure and heart diseases have _ links with stress. Since we cannot _ stress from our lives (it would be unwise to do so even if we could), we need to find ways to deal with it.
